intro: Tithymalus pygmaeus, commonly known as the dwarf tithymalus, is a small flowering plant native to specific regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its delicate, umbellate inflorescences. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are small and white or pale yellow. Tithymalus pygmaeus is often found in association with other shade-tolerant flora in its native habitat.
